original: @1b #// rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b #// rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya nishtha tan bha ga w'an dzny'a na bee pu lyan s'u tra ratna aa nanta n'a ma ma h'a y'a na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya nishtha tan bha ga w'an dzny'a na bee pu lyan s'u tra ratna aa nanta n'a ma ma h'a y'a na s'u tra /
translated: Ārya-niṣṭhā-tana-bhagavān-jñāna-vaipulya-sūtra-ratna-ananta-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes rgyas pa'i mdo sde rin po che mtha' yas pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes rgyas pa'i mdo sde rin po che mtha' yas pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: Ārya-bhagavān-jñāna-vaipulya-sūtra-ratna-ananta-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra.

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: The first chapter.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub @2a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub @2a *//
translated: The Buddha and the Bodhisattvas.

original: sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong stong nyis lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong stong nyis lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: the Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, together with a great saṅgha of 1,250 monks.

original: de'i tshe grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro zhes bya bar khyim bdag phyva mkhan zhig gis bcom ldan 'das kho na'i phyir bcom @2b ldan 'das kho na la dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro zhes bya bar khyim bdag phyva mkhan zhig gis bcom ldan 'das kho na'i phyir bcom @2b ldan 'das kho na la dmigs te /
translated: At that time, in the great city called Virtuous Shore, a master builder, for the sake of the Blessed One alone, with the Blessed One in mind,

original: bcom ldan 'das kho na'i ched du tshe dang ldan pa gang po lag gi bla byed du bcug nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho na'i ched du tshe dang ldan pa gang po lag gi bla byed du bcug nas /
translated: and for the sake of the Blessed One alone, had the venerable Pūrṇa appointed as his supervisor.

original: khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa zhig ring por ma thogs par byas te /
analyzed: khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa zhig ring por ma thogs par byas te /
translated: He had a mansion with a sandalwood courtyard built in no time at all.

original: ring por ma thogs par zin no //
analyzed: ring por ma thogs par zin no //
translated: It was completed in no time at all.

original: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so; ;gang po /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so; ;gang po /
translated: Then the master builder said to the venerable Pūrṇa, “Pūrṇa,

original: khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa 'di ni /🔽bcom ldan 'das kho na'i phyir byas /🔽bcom ldan 'das kho na la dmigs te /
analyzed: khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa 'di ni / bcom ldan 'das kho na'i phyir byas / bcom ldan 'das kho na la dmigs te /
translated: this mansion with a sandalwood courtyard🔽was built for the sake of the Blessed One alone.🔽It was built with the Blessed One in mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du byas pa yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du byas pa yin na /
translated: It was built for the sake of the Blessed One.

original: gzhan su zhig khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa 'di longs spyod par byed kyi /🔽ci nas bdag gi sbyin pa 'di 'bras @3a *//🔽bu che bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas bdag gi 'bad pa 'di don yod par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas bdag gi sbyin pa 'di longs spyod par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sbyin pa 'di btang ba dang / longs spyod na shin tu dga' ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan su zhig khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa 'di longs spyod par byed kyi / ci nas bdag gi sbyin pa 'di 'bras @3a *// bu che bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas bdag gi 'bad pa 'di don yod par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas bdag gi sbyin pa 'di longs spyod par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sbyin pa 'di btang ba dang / longs spyod na shin tu dga' ba dang /
translated: Who else will enjoy this mansion with a sandalwood courtyard?🔽I will give this gift in such a way that it will bear great fruit, in such a way that this effort of mine will not be wasted, in such a way that this gift will be enjoyed.

original: rab tu dga' ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When I give and enjoy this gift, I will be very happy and extremely joyful.”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang pos khyim bdag phyva mkhan la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang pos khyim bdag phyva mkhan la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyani­putra said to the householder Śreṣṭhi­pāla,

original: khyim bdag / khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa de /
analyzed: khyim bdag / khang bzang tsandan gyi khyams dang ldan pa de /
translated: “Householder, this mansion with a sandalwood courtyard

original: bcom ldan 'das kho na'i phyir byas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho na'i phyir byas /
translated: was built only for the Blessed One.🔽It was built only for the Blessed One, with the Blessed One in mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kho na la dmigs te bcom ldan 'das kho na'i ched du byas pa 'di /🔽dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho na la dmigs te bcom ldan 'das kho na'i ched du byas pa 'di /🔽dge sbyong ngam /
translated: It was built only for the Blessed One, for the sake of the Blessed One.🔽It was built only for the Blessed One, for the sake of the Blessed One.

original: bram ze gang gis kyang longs spyod par nus pa med do //
analyzed: bram ze gang gis kyang longs spyod par nus pa med do //
translated: No brahmin can enjoy it.

original: @3b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @3b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyim bdag / de bzhin gshegs pa'i lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de bzhin gshegs pa'i lhung bzed dam /
translated: Householder, the alms bowl of the Tathāgata,

original: chos gos sam /
analyzed: chos gos sam /
translated: his Dharma robes,

original: gding ba'am / bgo ba'am /🔽kun dga' ra ba'am /🔽'chag sa'am; stan nam /
analyzed: gding ba'am / bgo ba'am / kun dga' ra ba'am / 'chag sa'am; stan nam /
translated: his sitting mat,

original: gtsug lag khang de dag ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de dag ni /
translated: his monastery,🔽his walking path,🔽his seat,🔽and his temple

original: lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i mchod rten du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i mchod rten du gyur pa yin te /
translated: are a shrine for all beings, including gods, Māras, Brahmās, renunciants, and brahmins, as well as for humans and non-humans.

original: de ni / gzhan sus kyang longs spyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni / gzhan sus kyang longs spyod par mi nus so //
translated: No one else can enjoy them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong ngam /
translated: Why is that?

original: bram ze de gang yang med de /
analyzed: bram ze de gang yang med de /
translated: There are no renunciants or brahmins who have such qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ci 'dra ba de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ci 'dra ba de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong ngam /
translated: “A monk who possesses the qualities of a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha.

original: bram ze de gang yang med do //
analyzed: bram ze de gang yang med do //
translated: There is no ascetic or brahmin who possesses the qualities of a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ni /
translated: The Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha

original: yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: possesses immeasurable qualities.

original: khyim bdag / bcom ldan 'das de ni /🔽yon tan grangs med pa dang ldan /
analyzed: khyim bdag / bcom ldan 'das de ni / yon tan grangs med pa dang ldan /
translated: Householder, the Blessed One🔽possesses innumerable qualities,

original: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan /🔽yon tan gzhal du med pa dang ldan /🔽yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan /
analyzed: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan / yon tan gzhal du med pa dang ldan / yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan /
translated: inconceivable qualities,🔽immeasurable qualities,🔽unfathomable qualities,

original: yon tan brjod kyis mi lang ba dang ldan /🔽@4a *// pa'o; ;khyim bdag /
analyzed: yon tan brjod kyis mi lang ba dang ldan / @4a *// pa'o; ;khyim bdag /
translated: inexpressible qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni /🔽mkhyen pa tshad med pa dang ldan /🔽mkhyen pa grangs med pa dang ldan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni / mkhyen pa tshad med pa dang ldan / mkhyen pa grangs med pa dang ldan /
translated: Householder, the Blessed One🔽possesses immeasurable knowledge,🔽innumerable knowledge,

original: mkhyen pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan /
analyzed: mkhyen pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan /
translated: inconceivable knowledge,

original: mkhyen pa gzhal du med pa dang ldan /🔽mkhyen pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan /
analyzed: mkhyen pa gzhal du med pa dang ldan / mkhyen pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan /
translated: He has immeasurable knowledge.🔽He has infinite knowledge.

original: mkhyen pa brjod kyis mi lang ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa brjod kyis mi lang ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has inexpressible knowledge.

original: khyim bdag / de bzhin gshegs pa de ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de bzhin gshegs pa de ni /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata

original: gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: knows as it really is the knowledge of what is possible.

original: gnas shes pa kun 'byung shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen; gnas shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: gnas shes pa kun 'byung shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen; gnas shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of what is possible. He knows as it really is the cessation of the knowledge of what is possible.

original: gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is the path to the cessation of the knowledge of what is possible.

original: gnas ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of what is impossible.

original: gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the non-occurrence.

original: 'das pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'das pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the past,🔽He knows as it really is the knowledge of the origination of the knowledge of the past,🔽He knows as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the past,

original: 'das pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'das pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / 'das pa shes pa 'gog par @4b 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'das pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'das pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / 'das pa shes pa 'gog par @4b 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the future,🔽He knows as it really is the knowledge of the origination of the knowledge of the future,🔽He knows as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the future,

original: ma 'ongs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the future.

original: da ltar byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the present just as it is.

original: da ltar byung ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen; da ltar byung ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen; da ltar byung ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows the arising of the knowledge of the present just as it is. He knows the cessation of the knowledge of the present just as it is.

original: da ltar byung ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the path to the cessation of the knowledge of the present just as it is.

original: las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows karma just as it is.

original: las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows the arising of the knowledge of karma just as it is. He knows the cessation of the knowledge of karma just as it is.

original: las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the path to the cessation of the knowledge of karma just as it is.

original: yang dag par blang ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows right adoption just as it is.

original: yang dag par blang ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / yang dag par blang ba shes pa 'gog pa shes @5a *//
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / yang dag par blang ba shes pa 'gog pa shes @5a *//
translated: He knows the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the acceptance of the world as it is.

original: pa dang / yang dag par blang ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: pa dang / yang dag par blang ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the knowledge of the acceptance of the world as it is.

original: gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the knowledge of the intention of abiding as it really is.🔽He knows the knowledge of the origin of the intention of abiding.🔽He knows the knowledge of the cessation of the intention of abiding.

original: gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / gnas kyi bsam pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the intention of abiding.

original: rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the knowledge of the intention of cause as it really is.

original: rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rgyu'i bsam pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the origin of the knowledge of the thought of the cause, he knows the cessation of the knowledge of the thought of the cause, and he knows the path the cessation of the knowledge of the thought of the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the knowledge of the ripening of karma just as it is.

original: rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te //
translated: He knows the origin of the knowledge of the ripening of karma, he knows the cessation of the knowledge of the ripening of karma, and he knows the path the cessation of the knowledge of the ripening of karma.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the path that leads everywhere just as it is.

original: thams cad du 'gro @5b ba'i lam shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro @5b ba'i lam shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere, the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere, the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere, and the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.

original: khams du ma shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khams du ma shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “He knows as it really is the knowledge of the multiplicity of elements.

original: khams du ma shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / khams du ma shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / khams du ma shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams du ma shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / khams du ma shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / khams du ma shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the multiplicity of elements, the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the multiplicity of elements, and the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the multiplicity of elements.

original: khams sna tshogs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /

analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the knowledge of the defilement of ignorance just as it is,

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the knowledge of the defilement of ignorance, the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of ignorance, the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of ignorance, and the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the knowledge of ignorance, just as they are.

original: zad pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the knowledge of destruction, just as it is.

original: zad pa shes pa kun 'byung bshes pa dang / zag pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa kun 'byung bshes pa dang / zag pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of destruction, the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of destruction, and the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the knowledge of destruction, just as they are.

original: mi skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the knowledge of non-arising, just as it is.

original: mi skye ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / @9a *//
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / @9a *//
translated: He knows the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of non-arising, and the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the knowledge of non-arising, just as they are.

original: mi skye ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘This is the path to the cessation of the knowledge of non-arising.’

original: mi 'jigs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘This is the knowledge of fearlessness.’🔽He knows as it really is: ‘This is the origination of the knowledge of fearlessness.’🔽He knows as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of the knowledge of fearlessness.’

original: mi 'jigs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘This is the path to the cessation of the knowledge of fearlessness.’

original: so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘This is the knowledge of the analytical knowledges.’🔽He knows as it really is: ‘This is the origination of the knowledge of the analytical knowledges.’🔽He knows as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of the knowledge of the analytical knowledges.’

original: so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘This is the path to the cessation of the knowledge of the analytical knowledges.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the powers as it really is.🔽He knows the knowledge of the arising of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the powers as it really is, he knows the knowledge of the cessation of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the powers as it really is, and he knows the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the powers as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs @9b ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @9b ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the aspects of the path as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows perfectly the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the characteristics of the Tathagata’s wisdom,🔽he knows perfectly the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the characteristics of the Tathagata’s wisdom,🔽and he knows perfectly the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the knowledge of the characteristics of the Tathagata’s wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows perfectly the knowledge of the Tathagata’s abiding.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “They know the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the way of abiding, and they know the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the way of abiding, and they know the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the way of abiding.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “They know the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the faculties, and they know the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the faculties, and they know the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the faculties.

original: lus kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: lus kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “They know the knowledge of physical activity just as it is.

original: lus kyi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / lus kyi las shes pa @10a *//
analyzed: lus kyi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / lus kyi las shes pa @10a *//
translated: He knows the body’s activity as it really is,🔽he knows the arising of the body’s activity as it really is,🔽he knows the cessation of the body’s activity as it really is,

original: 'gog pa shes pa dang / lus kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa dang / lus kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and he knows the path to the cessation of the body’s activity as it really is.

original: ngag gi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: ngag gi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows speech as it really is,🔽he knows the arising of speech as it really is,🔽he knows the cessation of speech as it really is,

original: ngag gi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / ngag gi las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / ngag gi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ngag gi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / ngag gi las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / ngag gi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and he knows the path to the cessation of speech as it really is.🔽He knows mind as it really is,

original: yid kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yid kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: and he knows the arising of mind as it really is,

original: yid kyi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / yid kyi las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / yid kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yid kyi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / yid kyi las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / yid kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the mind faculty as it really is, knows the arising of the mind faculty as it really is, knows the cessation of the mind faculty as it really is, and knows the path to the cessation of the mind faculty as it really is.

original: sngon du 'gro ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the prior limit as it really is,

original: sngon du 'gro ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: knows the arising of the prior limit as it really is, knows the cessation of the prior limit as it really is, and knows the path to the cessation of the prior limit as it really is.

original: rjes su 'brang ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the subsequent limit as it really is,

original: rjes su 'brang ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rjes su 'brang ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rjes su @10b 'brang ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rjes su 'brang ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rjes su @10b 'brang ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the subsequent,🔽the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the subsequent, and the knowledge of the path the cessation of the knowledge of the subsequent.🔽He knows as it really is the knowledge of decline,

original: rjes su nyam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te; rjes su nyams pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rjes su nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rjes su nyams pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rjes su nyam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te; rjes su nyams pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / rjes su nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / rjes su nyams pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of decline, the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of decline, and the knowledge of the path the cessation of the knowledge of decline.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa 'gog pa shes pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the origin of the knowledge of omniscience, he knows the cessation of the knowledge of omniscience, and he knows the path to the cessation of the knowledge of omniscience.

original: khyim bdag / de ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ni /
translated: Householder, this is

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes rgyas pa bstan pa dang po ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes rgyas pa bstan pa dang po ste /
translated: the first teaching of the Blessed One’s vast wisdom.

original: de'i bshad pa nyon cig /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa nyon cig /
translated: Listen to the explanation of it.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of abodes as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa /
translated: Householder, in this regard the Tathāgata knows thus: ‘Whatever is the ripening of physical misconduct,

original: mi sdug pa /🔽yid du mi 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mi sdug pa / yid du mi 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: unattractive,🔽and unpleasant is

original: gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: an abode and an occasion.

original: ngag @11a *// gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: ngag @11a *// gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa /
translated: It is also possible to experience the undesirable, unpleasant, and disagreeable results of verbal and mental misdeeds.

original: mi sdug pa /🔽yid du mi 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: mi sdug pa / yid du mi 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is also possible to experience the undesirable, unpleasant, and disagreeable results of verbal and mental misdeeds.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is also possible to be reborn in the hells, the lower realms, and the negative forms of existence after the body breaks up and one dies due to the ripening of physical misdeeds.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is also possible to be reborn in the hells, the lower realms, and the negative forms of existence after the body breaks up and one dies due to the ripening of verbal and mental misdeeds.

original: lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
translated: It is also possible to experience the desirable results of physical good deeds.

original: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa 'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //🔽ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa 'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no // ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
translated: It is possible and there is an occasion for the attainment of what is pleasant and agreeable.🔽It is possible and there is an occasion for the attainment of the pleasant and agreeable results of good verbal and mental conduct.🔽It is possible and there is an occasion for the attainment of the pleasant and agreeable results of good physical conduct.

original: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no; ;lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig gnas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang @11b gnas🔽yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no; ;lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig gnas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang @11b gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is possible and there is an occasion for the attainment of the pleasant and agreeable results of good verbal and mental conduct.🔽It is possible and there is an occasion for the attainment of the pleasant and agreeable results of good physical conduct.

original: ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is possible and there is an occasion for the attainment of the pleasant and agreeable results of good verbal and mental conduct.

original: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las bsam bzhin du ma srog dang phral ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las bsam bzhin du ma srog dang phral ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is possible that an ordinary person might intentionally deprive an ordinary person of life.

original: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las bsam bzhin du pha srog dang phral ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //🔽'di na so so'i skye bo la las bsam bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dgra bcom pa srog dang phral ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las bsam bzhin du pha srog dang phral ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no // 'di na so so'i skye bo la las bsam bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dgra bcom pa srog dang phral ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is possible that an ordinary person might intentionally deprive his father of life.🔽It is possible that an ordinary person might intentionally deprive an arhat of the life of an arhat.

original: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las nyan thos kyi dge 'dun mthun pa phye ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las nyan thos kyi dge 'dun mthun pa phye ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is possible that an ordinary person might intentionally cause a schism in the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s śrāvakas.

original: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di na so so'i skye bo la las de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: It is possible that an ordinary person might intentionally draw blood from a tathāgata with evil intent.

translated: Here, it is possible for ordinary people to teach others, to compose their own treatises, to make others adopt the correct view, to make others adopt pure conduct,

original: la la dag gi dge mtshan dang / bkra shis mang po so so'i bden pa de dag gis dag pa yongs su tshol ba dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag gis bshad pa la phyogs shing /

analyzed: zhes bya ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //🔽'di ni so so'i skye bo la la mi'i srid pa brgyad mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: this is possible and an occasion

analyzed: 'di na skyes bu gang zag la la tshangs pa nyid sgrub pa'am /
translated: “Householder, in this world, it is possible for some people to become Brahmā,

original: bdud dam / bram ze sgrub pa gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: bdud dam / bram ze sgrub pa gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: or Māra, or a Brahmin.

original: 'di na skyes bu gang zag la la 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di na skyes bu gang zag la la 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: “Householder, in this world, it is possible for some people to become a wheel-turning king.

original: 'di na skyes bu gang zag la la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //

translated: “Householder, in this world, it is possible for some people to become a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa gcig byung ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa gcig byung ba gang yin pa'ang gnas yin zhing skabs yin no //
translated: “Householder, in this world, it is possible for a single tathāgata to appear in a single world system.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas @12b gnas shes pa rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas @12b gnas shes pa rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the knowable.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas thob pa'i gang zag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas thob pa'i gang zag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata also has perfect knowledge of the person who has attained the state of being a basis.

original: gang zag 'di ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod yin no //🔽gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod yin no // gang zag 'di ni /

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod yin no //🔽gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod yin no // gang zag 'di ni /
translated: This person is a vessel for the qualities of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽This person is a vessel for the qualities of a Śrāvaka.

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyi snod yin no; ;khyim bdag /🔽de ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyi snod yin no; ;khyim bdag / de ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Householder,🔽thus the Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of the state of being a basis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ste /🔽bskal pa brgya'am /

translated: or for a million eons,🔽or for ten million eons,

original: bskal pa dkrigs sam /

translated: He will answer with an inexpressible number of inexpressible answers, with an inexpressible number of inexpressible answers, with an inexpressible number of inexpressible answers, with an inexpressible number of inexpressible answers, and with an inexpressible number of inexpressible answers.

analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence will be inexhaustible.

original: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud de /
translated: It is because the Tathāgata has fully understood the unsurpassed realm of phenomena with his wisdom.

original: thugs su chud pa'i gnas gang la zhu ba zhus pa'i spobs pa mi zad do //
analyzed: thugs su chud pa'i gnas gang la zhu ba zhus pa'i spobs pa mi zad do //
translated: The eloquence of those who ask questions about the realm that is fully understood will be inexhaustible.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /

translated: The Tathāgata perfectly understands as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the abode.

translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata perfectly understands as it really is the cause and condition by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the abode is accomplished.

analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /

analyzed: gal te 'go pa'i nad du rjes su blta ba'am /

analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //

original: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

analyzed: 'di ni / gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa zhes bya ste /

translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the abodes, he could answer for an eon or for eons equal to the number of atoms in the continent, or for inexpressibly inexpressible numbers of eons.

original: // khyim bdag /
analyzed: // khyim bdag /
translated: Householder,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud de /

analyzed: de lta bas na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata thoroughly knows this:

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
translated: “The ripening of physical misconduct

original: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: is the attainment of what is desirable, lovely, and pleasing.

original: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //🔽ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no // ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa /
translated: It is impossible and out of the question.

original: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni /🔽gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni / gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: “It is impossible and out of the question that the results of verbal misconduct and mental misconduct should be desirable, agreeable, and pleasurable.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye ba gang yin pa de ni /🔽gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye ba gang yin pa de ni / gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: “It is impossible and out of the question that the results of bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct should be rebirth in a good place, in a heavenly world after death.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i yang de bzhin no //🔽lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i yang de bzhin no // lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa /
translated: “It is impossible and out of the question that the results of verbal misconduct and mental misconduct should be desirable, agreeable, and pleasurable.

original: mi sdug pa /🔽yid @16b du mi 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mi sdug pa / yid @16b du mi 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: “It is impossible and out of the question that the results of good bodily conduct should be undesirable, disagreeable, and unpleasurable.

original: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: “It is impossible and out of the question that the results of good verbal conduct and good mental conduct should be undesirable, disagreeable, and unpleasurable.

original: ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'ang de bzhin no; ;lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'ang de bzhin no; ;lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: Likewise, the ripening of good physical actions, good verbal actions, and good mental actions is that after the body has disintegrated and death has occurred, one is born among the hell realms, which are a bad destination, a lower realm, and an unfortunate state.

original: de bzhin du ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pas lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba ni /
translated: Likewise, the ripening of good physical actions, good verbal actions, and good mental actions is that after the body has disintegrated and death has occurred, one is born among the hell realms, which are a bad destination, a lower realm, and an unfortunate state.

original: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: This is impossible and cannot happen.

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag gis bsam bzhin du ma srog dang phral ba dang / de bzhin du pha dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun phye ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba gang yin pa de ni /🔽gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag gis bsam bzhin du ma srog dang phral ba dang / de bzhin du pha dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun phye ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba gang yin pa de ni / gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: or in the same way, kill an arhat,🔽or in the same way, cause a schism in the Saṅgha,🔽or in the same way, draw blood from a Tathāgata with an evil thought.🔽It is impossible and there is no chance that a person who is perfect in view would follow another teacher,🔽or in the same way, that someone outside this religion would adopt the correct view,

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis ston pa gzhan rnam par bsten pa dang / de bzhin du 'di las phyi rol pa gzhan gyis yang dag pa'i lta ba 'cha' zhing bcas pa dang / sbyangs pa gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis ston pa gzhan rnam par bsten pa dang / de bzhin du 'di las phyi rol pa gzhan gyis yang dag pa'i lta ba 'cha' zhing bcas pa dang / sbyangs pa gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang /
translated: or in the same way, that someone outside this religion would take up the pure practices,

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze gang yang rung ba la la dag @17a *//
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze gang yang rung ba la la dag @17a *//
translated: or in the same way, that any ascetic or brahmin

original: gis dge mtshan dang / bkra shis mang po so so'i bden pa de dag gis yang dag par 'dod pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag gis bshad pa la phyogs shing /🔽tshe dang ldan pa shes par bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gis dge mtshan dang / bkra shis mang po so so'i bden pa de dag gis yang dag par 'dod pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag gis bshad pa la phyogs shing / tshe dang ldan pa shes par bya ba 'di ni /
translated: They side with the explanations of other ascetics and brahmins.🔽Venerable Śāriputra, it is not possible or reasonable

original: shes par bya /🔽blta bar bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: shes par bya / blta bar bya ba 'di ni /
translated: for one to know what is to be known,🔽or to see what is to be seen.

original: mthong bar bya ba gang yin pa'ang gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong bar bya ba gang yin pa'ang gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is not possible or reasonable

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag gis mi'i srid pa brgyad mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag gis mi'i srid pa brgyad mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa ni /
translated: for a person who has perfected the view to establish the eight human existences.

original: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no; ;bud med bdag gi dngos po de nyid kyis brgya byin nam /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no; ;bud med bdag gi dngos po de nyid kyis brgya byin nam /
translated: It is not possible or reasonable for a woman to become Śakra,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa sgrub pa gang yin pa ni /🔽gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa sgrub pa gang yin pa ni / gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: or a demon, or Brahmā,🔽by means of her female state.🔽It is not possible or reasonable for a woman to become a universal monarch

original: bud med bdag gi dngos po de nyid kyis 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bud med bdag gi dngos po de nyid kyis 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: by means of her female state.

original: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: It is impossible and out of the question.

original: bud med bdag gi dngos po de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /🔽gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: bud med bdag gi dngos po de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni / gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: It is impossible and out of the question that a woman should become a Tathāgata, a saint, perfectly enlightened, fully clear in conduct, well gone, an understander of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who are to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Fortunate One.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis 'jig rten du 'byung ba gang yin @17b pa'ang gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis 'jig rten du 'byung ba gang yin @17b pa'ang gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no //
translated: It is impossible and out of the question that two Tathāgatas, saints, perfectly enlightened ones should appear in the world simultaneously.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, thus

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata accurately knows what is impossible.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa thob pa'i gang zag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa thob pa'i gang zag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata accurately knows the person who attains what is impossible.

original: gang zag 'dis sangs rgyas khrag khrig 'di snyed cig thugs byung bar byas pas /
analyzed: gang zag 'dis sangs rgyas khrag khrig 'di snyed cig thugs byung bar byas pas /
translated: This person has served as many as ten trillion buddhas,🔽but the Tathāgata knows that he is not a vessel for the Dharma of the buddhas, the pratyekabuddhas, or the śrāvakas.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyi snod ma yin pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyi snod ma yin pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata’s knowledge of what is not possible is just as it is, and he knows it as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about what is not possible, he would answer for an eon, or for an eon minus one instant, or for an eon plus one instant, or for an incalculably long eon, or for an incalculably long eon minus one instant, or for an incalculably long eon plus one instant, or for an inexpressible eon, or for an inexpressible eon minus one instant, or for an inexpressible eon plus one instant, or for an eon of the world’s becoming and ending, or for an eon of the world’s becoming and ending minus one instant, or for an eon of the world’s becoming and ending plus one instant, or for twice an inexpressible eon, or for twice an inexpressible eon minus one instant, or for twice an inexpressible eon plus one instant, or for twice an eon of the world’s becoming and ending, or for twice an eon of the world’s becoming and ending minus one instant, or for twice an eon of the world’s becoming and ending plus one instant.🔽His eloquence would not cease.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so; ;de lta bas na /
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so; ;de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: the one whose knowledge and vision are unobstructed🔽will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro; ;khyim bdag /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro; ;khyim bdag /
translated: Householder,

original: gzhan yang ji ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar na /
translated: how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-abiding as it really is?”

original: @18a *// khyim bdag /
analyzed: @18a *// khyim bdag /
translated: Householder,

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: in this regard, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the cause and condition by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-abiding is accomplished.

original: gal te rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If one dwells in the view of permanence,

original: gal te sdug bsngal ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one views it as not suffering,

original: gal te nad ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /🔽gal te 'bras ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te nad ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am / gal te 'bras ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one views it as not a disease,

original: gal te zug rngu ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te zug rngu ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one views it as not a boil,🔽or if one views it as not a thorn,

original: gal te sdig pa ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te sdig pa ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one views it as not a crime,

original: gal te gzhan ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te gzhan ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one views it as not other,

original: gal te 'jig pa ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am; gal te g-yo ba ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am; gal te g-yo ba ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: If one observes it as not being impermanent,🔽or if one observes it as not moving,

original: gal te rab tu 'jig pa ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te rab tu 'jig pa ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one observes it as not being completely destroyed,

original: gal te 'go ba'i nad ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te 'go ba'i nad ma yin par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one observes it as not being a chronic disease,

original: gal te mi stong bar rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te mi stong bar rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one observes it as not being empty,

original: gal te bdag yod par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te bdag yod par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one observes it as having a self,🔽or if one observes it as not being the exhalation of breath,

original: gal te dbugs 'byung ba med par rjes su blta ba'am; gal te nyes dmigs med par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te dbugs 'byung ba med par rjes su blta ba'am; gal te nyes dmigs med par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one observes it as not being a calamity,🔽or if one observes it as not being a disaster,

original: gal te gnod pa med par rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa med par rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: or if one observes it as not being an adversary,

original: gal te phyir rgol ba ma yin par rjes su blta @18b bar gnas pa ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol ba ma yin par rjes su blta @18b bar gnas pa ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the impermanence of the impermanent.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen /
translated: The Tathāgata knows it,

original: thugs su chud /
analyzed: thugs su chud /
translated: he understands it,

original: mngon sum du mdzad do //
analyzed: mngon sum du mdzad do //
translated: he has direct perception of it.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gang gis gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gang gis gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-abiding, as it truly is.

original: 'di ni / gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-abiding.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, when asked about that knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-abiding, would answer for an eon, or for an eon multiplied by ten, or a hundred, or a thousand, or a hundred thousand, or a hundred thousand multiplied by a trillion, or for an inexpressible number of inexpressibly many eons.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not be exhausted.

original: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Householder, why is that?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud par mdzad cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud par mdzad cing /
translated: It is because the Tathāgata has fully understood the unsurpassed realm of phenomena with his wisdom.

original: gang thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: gang thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-basis is such that if one were to ask him about it, he could answer for an eon, or for eons, up to eons as numerous as the atoms in a world-system.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not fail him.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /🔽tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs @19a *//
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs @19a *//
translated: one whose knowledge and vision is unobstructed

original: spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the non-basis?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ma brten pa'i sems can rnams gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes par gyur cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ma brten pa'i sems can rnams gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes par gyur cing /
translated: “Householder, when sentient beings who are not dependent on the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of what is not the case,

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa la brten na bral te /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa la brten na bral te /
translated: they are separated from it when they depend on the Tathāgata.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in that way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of what is not the case.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows this:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing /
translated: ‘Having benefited immeasurable sentient beings

original: don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: and turned them away from what is not the benefit,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
translated: having made light and dispelled darkness,

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: having liberated immeasurable sentient beings from suffering and established them in happiness,

original: gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste /
translated: the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of what is not the case

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: is unborn from the beginning.’

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: “Householder, in that way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu @19b mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu @19b mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata, knowing the cessation of the knowledge of the non-basis, knows it just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the non-basis, he could answer for an eon or more than an eon,

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: and his eloquence would not cease.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: one whose knowledge and insight are unobstructed

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang; khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang; khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who knows the path to the cessation of the knowledge of the non-basis, know it?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata knows it thus:

original: shin tu rmongs pa gang gis gnas ma yin pa ston pa la mi shes pa byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa de ni /
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa gang gis gnas ma yin pa ston pa la mi shes pa byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa de ni /
translated: The extreme delusion that arises from not knowing what is not a basis is

original: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ste /
translated: devoid of essence.

original: des na / shin tu rmongs pa'i chos med de /
analyzed: des na / shin tu rmongs pa'i chos med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no phenomenon of extreme delusion.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are devoid of essence.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis gnas ma yin pa shes pa yongs su shes pa'i 'gog pa shes @20a *//
