analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis gnas ma yin pa shes pa yongs su shes pa'i 'gog pa shes @20a *//
translated: the Tathāgata knows as it really is the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of what is not a basis.

original: ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of what is not a basis.🔽If one abides in the observation of the absence of enjoyment,

original: gal te nyes dmigs med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: or if one abides in the observation of the absence of disadvantages,

original: gal te nges par 'byung ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par lan gsung ste /
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de bzhin gshegs pa gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par lan gsung ste /
translated: If one were to ask about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of what is and is not possible, he would answer for an eon, or even more than an eon.🔽🔽If one were to ask about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the future, he would answer for an eon, or even more than an eon.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: If one were to ask about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of what is possible and impossible, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon or for even longer than an eon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud cing /
translated: Because the Tathāgata has fully understood the supreme Dharma-element with his wisdom.

original: gang thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa la zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste
analyzed: gang thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa la zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste
translated: When asked about the knowledge of the path that stops the knowledge of the Tathagata who has realized the non-abiding, he answers for eons up to inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: / de lta bas na 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta bas na 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one whose wisdom vision enters without obstruction will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace here.

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, moreover, how does

original: de bzhin gshegs pas @20b 'das pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas @20b 'das pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the Tathagata know the past correctly?

original: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this regard, the Tathagata knows the buddhas, buddhafields, and sentient beings of immeasurable past eons.

original: 'das pa'i bskal ba grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //🔽'das pa'i bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i yang dpag tu med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i bskal ba grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to // 'das pa'i bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i yang dpag tu med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang /
translated: He knows the buddhas, the buddha-fields, and the sentient beings of the past, of the future, and of the present.🔽He knows the buddhas, the buddha-fields, and the sentient beings of the past, of the future, and of the present.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the buddhas, the buddha-fields, and the sentient beings of the past, of the future, and of the present.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te 'das pa'i bskal ba brjod du med pa'i dpag tu med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i grangs med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / brjod du med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te 'das pa'i bskal ba brjod du med pa'i dpag tu med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i grangs med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / brjod du med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang /
translated: In the same vein, it is the same for past eons that are inexpressible, immeasurable, incalculable, inconceivable, and beyond measure.🔽

original: brjod du med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs @21a *//
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs @21a *//
translated: In the same vein, it is so too with the past, with the inexpressible, the immeasurable, the infinite, the inconceivable, the incomparable, the immeasurable, the uncountable, and the utterly uncountable kalpas.

original: rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The tathāgatas know the buddhas, the buddhafields, and the sentient beings of the past.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang; yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang; yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, comprehension, and expertise that is in regard to this are called

original: 'das pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ‘knowledge of the past.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The tathāgatas know the past correctly and in accordance with reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te yongs su longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te yongs su longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask about the knowledge of the tathāgatas of the past, the answer would be the same, and so on up to the knowledge of the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as previously explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the future as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the buddhas and buddha-fields and sentient beings of immeasurable future eons.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i @21b yang dpag tu med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang // dpag tu med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to // ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i @21b yang dpag tu med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang // dpag tu med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang /
translated: He knows the future buddhas, buddha-fields, and sentient beings of countless, inconceivable, immeasurable, and inexpressible eons.🔽He knows the future buddhas, buddha-fields, and sentient beings of countless, immeasurable, immeasurable, inconceivable, immeasurable, immeasurable, and inexpressible eons.

original: dpag tu med pa'i brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen pa nas ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen pa nas ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang /
translated: He knows the future buddhas, buddha-fields, and sentient beings of countless, immeasurable, immeasurable, inconceivable, immeasurable, immeasurable, and inexpressible eons, up to the future buddhas, buddha-fields, and sentient beings of inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows sentient beings.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, full understanding, and expertise that is in regard to that

original: ma 'ongs pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called ‘knowledge of the future.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'ongs pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'ongs pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: If he were asked a question about that knowledge of the future of the Tathāgata, he could answer it for an eon or for eons, up to an eon that is inexpressible through any expression.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not be exhausted.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: one whose knowledge-vision is unobstructed in this way

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as taught.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang ji ltar na /
translated: “Moreover, Householder,

original: de bzhin gshegs @22a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @22a *//
translated: how does the Tathāgata

original: pas da ltar byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: pas da ltar byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does the Tathāgata know the present in accordance with reality?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas da ltar byung ba'i shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can dpag tu med pa rnams rab tu mkhyen te /🔽da ltar byung ba grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas da ltar byung ba'i shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can dpag tu med pa rnams rab tu mkhyen te / da ltar byung ba grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the present buddhas and buddha-fields in the east, and the immeasurable sentient beings,🔽the present countless, inconceivable, immeasurable, unfathomable, inexpressible buddhas, buddha-fields, and sentient beings, and similarly,

original: da ltar byung ba'i bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag gi sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: the present buddhas, buddha-fields, and sentient beings up to inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, full understanding, and expertise that is in regard to that is

original: da ltar byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called the knowledge of the present.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of that as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung pa nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung pa nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata a question about the knowledge of the present, he could answer it for an eon or for eons, even up to inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: de'i spobs @22b pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs @22b pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not be exhausted.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: one whose knowledge and seeing is unobstructed in this way

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as previously explained.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang ji ltar na /
translated: “Also,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: householder, how does the Tathāgata know action as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa'i las bzhi rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa'i las bzhi rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Here, householder, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the four kinds of action that are taken up:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / myong bar mi 'gyur ba'i las so //
analyzed: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / myong bar mi 'gyur ba'i las so //
translated: Action that one experiences in this life, action that one experiences upon rebirth, action that one experiences in another life, and action that one experiences in some future life.🔽That which is knowledge,🔽seeing, clarity,🔽realization,

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: penetration, and expertise regarding that is called

original: las shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ‘knowledge of action.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows action as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: If someone were to ask that knower of actions questions for an eon, or for eons, up to eons beyond what can be expressed by speech, the Tathāgata would answer those questions.

original: longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on up to: he would enjoy them.

original: bam po gnyis pa /🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar @23a *//
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa / khyim bdag / ji ltar @23a *//
translated: Chapter Two

original: na; de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: na; de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, Worthy and Perfect Buddha, with his knowledge of the arising of actions, know the arising of actions?

original: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis las dang kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis las dang kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata has knowledge of the causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of actions is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de /
translated: If he were to remain contemplating impermanence, up to if he were to remain contemplating the adversary,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known the knowledge of the arising of karma exactly as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, when asked about the knowledge of the arising of karma, the Tathāgata would explain it, and in so doing would engage in conversation for an eon or more.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the cessation of the knowledge of karma exactly as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows in this way:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la; snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la; snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
translated: ‘Having benefited countless beings and turned them away from what is not beneficial, having illuminated what was dark,

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: having liberated countless beings from suffering and brought them to happiness,

original: las shes pa @23b 'gog pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: las shes pa @23b 'gog pa shes pa ste /
translated: I have known the cessation of the knowledge of karma.

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: And that is unborn from the beginning.’

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, it is so.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata perfectly understands as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of karma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: And if questioned about that knowledge of the cessation of karma, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon or for the remainder of an eon, or for inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not cease.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata perfectly understand as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of karma?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis las shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis las shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata, with knowledge, understands karma and its knowledge,

original: khong du chud /
analyzed: khong du chud /
translated: he understands it,

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows perfectly the cessation of the knowledge of cessation.

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If one abides in the observation of the absence of relishing,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if one abides in the observation of the faults,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or if one abides in the observation of the escape, the Tathāgata knows it perfectly.

original: khyim bdag / da ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa @24a *//
analyzed: khyim bdag / da ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas las shes pa @24a *//
translated: Householder, now🔽the Tathāgata knows perfectly the knowledge of karma

original: 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and the path leading to the cessation of the knowledge of karma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung zhing bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung zhing bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par lan gsung ste /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of the path leading to the cessation of the knowledge of karma, he could answer for an eon or for inexpressibly inexpressible eons,

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: and his eloquence would not be exhausted.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Supreme Buddha know the understanding of correct taking as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa'i las bzhi po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa'i las bzhi po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is the four kinds of actions of correct taking.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la /
translated: What are the four?🔽There is the action of correct taking that is suffering in the present and has a result of suffering in the future.🔽There is the action of correct taking that is pleasant in the present but has a result of suffering in the future.

original: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las yod pa dang / da ltar byung ba na bde la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las yod pa dang / da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa bde ba yang dag par len pa'i las yod pa dang /
analyzed: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las yod pa dang / da ltar byung ba na bde la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las yod pa dang / da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa bde ba yang dag par len pa'i las yod pa dang /
translated: There is the action of correct taking that is suffering in the present but has a result of happiness in the future.

original: da ltar byung ba na'ang bde la phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang @24b dag par len pa'i las yod do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na'ang bde la phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang @24b dag par len pa'i las yod do //
translated: There is also the karma of taking up what is wholesome, which is pleasant in the present and has pleasant karmic ripening in the future.

original: da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What is the karma of taking up what is unwholesome, which is painful in the present and has painful karmic ripening in the future?

original: yang dag par len pa'i las gang dge sbyong dang bram ze mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa'i las gang dge sbyong dang bram ze mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the karma of taking up what is unwholesome, which is despised by the wise, such as the ascetics and the brahmins.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par len pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par len pa yin te /
translated: It is the karma of taking up the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: de'ang 'dod chags drag po dang / zhe sdang drag po dang / gti mug drag pos yang dag par blangs pa ni /
analyzed: de'ang 'dod chags drag po dang / zhe sdang drag po dang / gti mug drag pos yang dag par blangs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, it is the karma of taking up what is unwholesome through intense desire, intense anger, and intense ignorance.

original: dbul ba'i sdug bsngal yang dag par blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: dbul ba'i sdug bsngal yang dag par blangs pa yin la /
translated: It is the karma of taking up the suffering of poverty.

original: de'ang tshe 'di nyid la mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de'ang tshe 'di nyid la mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par bya ba yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, it is the karma of taking up what is unwholesome, which is despised by the wise in this very life.

original: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: In the future, it has undesirable karmic ripening.

original: yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni /🔽da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni / da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la /
translated: This action of taking up what is right🔽is suffering in the present.🔽

original: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yin no //🔽da ltar byung ba na bde la /
analyzed: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yin no // da ltar byung ba na bde la /
translated: This is the karma that is painful to perform and has a painful ripening.

original: phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What is the karma that is pleasant to perform and has a painful ripening?

original: 'dod chags drag po dang / zhe sdang drag po dang / gti mug drag po dang / dbang phyug gi dbang gis yang dag par blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags drag po dang / zhe sdang drag po dang / gti mug drag po dang / dbang phyug gi dbang gis yang dag par blangs pa yin te /
translated: It is the karma that is taken up through intense desire, intense anger, and intense ignorance, and through the power of a lord.

original: 'di lta ste; mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa yin la /🔽de tshe 'di nyid la longs spyod kyi grangs su 'gyur zhing /🔽byis pa rnams kyis kyang bsngags la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa yin la / de tshe 'di nyid la longs spyod kyi grangs su 'gyur zhing / byis pa rnams kyis kyang bsngags la /
translated: It is the karma that is taken up through the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: @25a *// mkhas pa rnams kyis ni /🔽smad la / phyi ma la'ang mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: @25a *// mkhas pa rnams kyis ni / smad la / phyi ma la'ang mi 'dod pa /
translated: It is the karma that is praised by fools and condemned by the wise.

original: mi sdug pa dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: It is the karma that is not desired and is not beautiful.

original: byis pa rnams kyis bsngags la /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis bsngags la /
translated: It is the karma that is praised by fools and condemned by the wise.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni /🔽da ltar byung ba na bde la /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni / da ltar byung ba na bde la /
translated: “What is the action of taking up that is criticized by the wise, which is pleasant in the present but has a ripening in the future that is painful?🔽It is the action of taking up that is painful in the present and has a ripening in the future that is pleasant?🔽It is the action of taking up that is painful in the present and has a ripening in the future that is pleasant.

original: phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: It is the action of taking up that is pleasant in the present and has a ripening in the future that is painful.🔽It is the action of taking up that is pleasant in the present and has a ripening in the future that is pleasant.

original: da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la; phyi ma la rnam par smin pa bde ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na /🔽'dod chags drag po dang / zhe sdang drag po dang / gti mug drag po gang dag so sor rtog pa 'dis las kyi ro myang ba la zhugs la /🔽dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te dbul ba zil gyis mnan nas tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa; mkhas pa rnams kyis bzung ba //🔽sdug bsngal la bzod pa /🔽yid mi bde ba la bzod pa /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na'ang sdug bsngal la; phyi ma la rnam par smin pa bde ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na / 'dod chags drag po dang / zhe sdang drag po dang / gti mug drag po gang dag so sor rtog pa 'dis las kyi ro myang ba la zhugs la / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te dbul ba zil gyis mnan nas tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa; mkhas pa rnams kyis bzung ba // sdug bsngal la bzod pa / yid mi bde ba la bzod pa /
translated: What is the action of taking up that is painful in the present and has a ripening in the future that is painful?

original: dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par len pa /🔽'phags pa'i chos yang dag par len pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par len pa / 'phags pa'i chos yang dag par len pa ste /
translated: It is the action of taking up that is pleasant in the present and has a ripening in the future that is painful.🔽What is the action of taking up that is pleasant in the present and has a ripening in the future that is pleasant?

original: yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni /
translated: It is the action of taking up that is pleasant in the present and has a ripening in the future that is pleasant.🔽What is the action of taking up that is painful in the present and has a ripening in the future that is painful?

original: da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la /
translated: It is painful in the present,

original: phyi ma la rnam par smin pa bde ba yin no //🔽da ltar byung ba na'ang bde la /
analyzed: phyi ma la rnam par smin pa bde ba yin no // da ltar byung ba na'ang bde la /
translated: but has a happy ripening in the future.🔽What is the action that is happy in the present

original: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang dag par len pa'i las gang zhe na /
translated: and has a happy ripening in the future?

original: 'dod chags chung ba dang / zhe sdang chung ba dang / gti mug chung ba dang / @25b shes pa gsal ba gang dag gis tshul bzhin so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags chung ba dang / zhe sdang chung ba dang / gti mug chung ba dang / @25b shes pa gsal ba gang dag gis tshul bzhin so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: It is the action of those who have little desire, little anger, and little ignorance, who have clear knowledge, and who investigate thoroughly.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs shing yo byad phun sum tshogs kyang dbang phyug dang / rgyags pa zil gyis mnan nas dge ba'i phyogs kyi gzhi la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs shing yo byad phun sum tshogs kyang dbang phyug dang / rgyags pa zil gyis mnan nas dge ba'i phyogs kyi gzhi la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the action of those who have taken up the path of the ten virtues, who have abundant wealth, who have overcome pride and conceit, and who are established in the basis of virtue.

original: de tshe 'di la'ang bde la yo byad bde ba nyams su myong zhing mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang bstod pa yin la /
analyzed: de tshe 'di la'ang bde la yo byad bde ba nyams su myong zhing mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang bstod pa yin la /
translated: In this life, they experience happiness and the happiness of wealth, and are praised by the wise.

original: phyi ma la'ang de'i 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma la'ang de'i 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the next life, they will have what they desire, what is lovely, and what is pleasing.

original: yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa'i las 'di ni /
translated: This is the karma of correct adoption.

original: tshe 'di la'ang bde la; phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa bde ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di la'ang bde la; phyi ma la'ang rnam par smin pa bde ba yin no //
translated: It is happiness in this life and happiness in future lives.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization, thorough understanding, and expertise that is in regard to that is

original: yang dag par len pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called the knowledge of correct adoption.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has thoroughly known that knowledge of correct adoption as it really is.🔽When asked about that knowledge of correct adoption of the Tathāgata, he would answer for an eon or more than an eon,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas bskal ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: up to answering for eons as numerous as the atoms in a world system.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not cease.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: He would answer in that way.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.

original: khyim bdag / @26a *//
analyzed: khyim bdag / @26a *//
translated: Householder,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how is it

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos yang dag par len pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos yang dag par len pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of correct grasping as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang gis yang dag par len pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang gis yang dag par len pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the cause and condition by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of correct grasping is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If one abides in the view of impermanence, up to if one abides in the view of opposition, the Tathāgata knows that as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, who knows the arising of the knowledge of the true origin of suffering, when asked a question, would answer for an eon, or for two eons, or for three, four, five, or even up to a hundred eons,

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: and his eloquence would not be exhausted.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, know and see the cessation of the knowledge of the true origin of suffering as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu @26b mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu @26b mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this regard, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: Having benefited immeasurable sentient beings and turned them away from what is not beneficial,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
translated: having illuminated what was dark and dispelled it,

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: Having liberated countless sentient beings from suffering and established them in happiness,

original: yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste /
translated: he knows the cessation of the knowledge of the appropriation of suffering.

original: de yang gzod ma nas ma skyes ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: de yang gzod ma nas ma skyes ba'i chos can no //
translated: Moreover, it is a dharma that has not arisen from the beginning.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the appropriation of suffering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung la /
translated: When asked about that knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the appropriation of suffering, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon, or he would answer for eons until the exhaustion of questions,

original: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: or he would answer for inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this place, from the sandalwood courtyard up to the fine mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par len pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the path the realization of which stops the knowledge of appropriation as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis yang dag par len pa shes pa yongs su shes /🔽khong du chud /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis yang dag par len pa shes pa yongs su shes / khong du chud /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata, with knowledge, fully knows the cessation of the knowledge of appropriation,🔽understands it,

original: mngon sum du byas @27a *//
analyzed: mngon sum du byas @27a *//
translated: and actualizes it.

original: pa'i 'gog pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: pa'i 'gog pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata knows that as it really is.🔽If one abides observing the absence of enjoyment,

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am; gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am; gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if one abides observing the disadvantages,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or if one abides observing definite emergence, the Tathāgata knows that as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par len pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: When asked about the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the Tathāgata, he would answer for an eon, or for an incalculable eon, or for as many incalculable eons as there are sands in the Ganges River.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not fail him.

original: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood palace and courtyard.

original: khyim bdag ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas gnas dang gnas kyi shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: khyim bdag ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas gnas dang gnas kyi shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the possible and the impossible?

original: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽las 'di lta bu ni sems can dmyal ba'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / las 'di lta bu ni sems can dmyal ba'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata has this kind of knowledge:🔽“This karma will ripen in the hells.

original: las 'di lta bu ni dud 'gro'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni dud 'gro'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This karma will ripen in the animal realm.

original: las 'di lta bu ni gshin rje'i gnas su @27b rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni gshin rje'i gnas su @27b rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the realm of the Lord of Death.

original: las 'di lta bu ni lham yin gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni lham yin gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the realm of the gods.

original: las 'di lta bu ni mi'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni mi'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the human realm.

original: las 'di lta bu ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the realm of the Four Great Kings.

original: las 'di lta bu ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //🔽las 'di lta bu ni 'thab bral gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro // las 'di lta bu ni 'thab bral gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the realm of the Thirty-Three.🔽This type of karma will ripen in the realm of the Yāma gods.

original: las 'di lta bu ni 'phrul dga'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni 'phrul dga'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the realm of the gods who delight in creation.

original: las 'di lta bu ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the realm of the gods who control others’ creations.

original: las 'di lta bu ni tshangs pa'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni tshangs pa'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This type of karma will ripen in the realm of Brahmā.

original: tshangs ris kyi gnas dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi gnas dang / tshangs pa chen po'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi gnas dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi gnas dang / tshangs pa chen po'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will ripen in the realm of Brahma’s Retinue, in the realm of Brahma’s Ministers, and in the realm of Great Brahma.

original: las 'di lta bu ni 'od dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni 'od dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This kind of action will ripen in the realm of Luminous Light, in the realm of Immeasurable Light, and in the realm of Radiant Light.

original: las 'di lta bu ni dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This kind of action will ripen in the realm of Virtue, in the realm of Immeasurable Virtue, in the realm of Perfected Virtue, and in the realm of Vast Virtue.

original: las 'di lta bu ni che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba'i gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //🔽las 'di lta bu ni mi che ba @28a *//🔽dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / 'og min gyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //

translated: This kind of action will ripen in the realm of Great Fruit, in the realm of Immeasurable Greatness, in the realm of Perfected Greatness, and in the realm of Vast Greatness.

original: las 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: las 'di lta bu ni /
translated: This kind of action will ripen in the realm of No Hardship, in the realm of No Heat, in the realm of Excellent Vision, in the realm of Excellent Intelligence, and in the realm of No-thought.🔽This kind of action will ripen in the realm of the Highest Heaven.

original: dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi rnam par smin pa /
analyzed: dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi rnam par smin pa /
translated: the Paritta Shubhas, Apramanasubhas, Shubhakrisnas, and Brihatphalas,🔽the Avrihas, Atapa, Sudrsa, Sudarsana, and Akanistha gods.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dang / dmigs pa gang dag gis las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon du yang dag par byed pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dang / dmigs pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dang / dmigs pa gang dag gis las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon du yang dag par byed pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dang / dmigs pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the causes, conditions, and objects by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the causes, conditions, and objects by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the causes, conditions, and objects by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the causes, conditions, and objects by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dang / dmigs pa gang dag gis las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon du yang dag par byed pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dang / dmigs pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dang / dmigs pa gang dag gis las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon du yang dag par byed pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dang / dmigs pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the conditions by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the conditions by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the objects by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the objects by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the conditions by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the conditions by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the objects by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the objects by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu mkhyen pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu mkhyen pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the conditions by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the conditions by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the objects by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the objects by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is actualized, and he precisely knows the causes by which the ripening of karma is not actualized.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If he were to be asked about the knowledge of causes, he could answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams kyi rgyu shes pa kun 'byung ba @30b shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams kyi rgyu shes pa kun 'byung ba @30b shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of causes just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis rgyu shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis rgyu shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata knows just as it is the causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of causes is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te //
translated: If he abides in the observation of impermanence, up to if he abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows that just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the cause, the knowledge of the origin, he would answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, you will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the cause?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: Having benefited countless sentient beings and turned them away from what is not beneficial,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
translated: having illuminated what was dark and dispelled it,

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: having liberated countless sentient beings from suffering and brought them to happiness,

original: rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste /🔽de'ang gzod ma nas ma @31a *//
analyzed: rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste / de'ang gzod ma nas ma @31a *//
translated: it is the knowledge of the cessation of the cause.

original: skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: Moreover, it is a dharma that has not arisen from the beginning.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: “Householder, it is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Thus the Tathāgata, with his knowledge of the cessation of the cause, knows the cessation of the cause in accordance with reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: When asked about this knowledge of the cessation of the cause, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon or more than an eon,

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: and he would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, with his knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the cause, know the path that leads to the cessation of the cause in accordance with reality?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yongs su shes /🔽khong du chud /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yongs su shes / khong du chud /
translated: “Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata, with the knowledge by which he knows the path that leads to the cessation of the cause, knows the cessation of the cause in accordance with reality.🔽He knows it, understands it,

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: and realizes it directly.🔽“

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta ba'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta ba'am /
translated: If he abides in the contemplation of the absence of taste,🔽or if he abides in the contemplation of the absence of faults,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar blta bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar blta bar gnas pa ste /
translated: or if he abides in the contemplation of the absence of escape,

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of causes.

original: khyim bdag / rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i @31b lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag / rgyu shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i @31b lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: “Householder, when asked about the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of causes, he would answer for an eon, or even for an eon multiplied by a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand koṭis.

original: de'i spongs pa zad mi shes so; ;de bzhin du sbyar te de ni /
analyzed: de'i spongs pa zad mi shes so; ;de bzhin du sbyar te de ni /
translated: His knowledge would not be exhausted.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, he would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the maturation of actions as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
translated: ‘This kind of maturation of action

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: will ripen in the realms of sentient beings.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
translated: This kind of maturation of action

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: will ripen in the animal realm.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
translated: This kind of maturation of action

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: will ripen in the world of Yama, up to🔽this kind of maturation of action

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rnams su rnam par smin pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rnams su rnam par smin pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: will ripen in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'di lta bu ni /
translated: This kind of maturation of action

original: rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: will not ripen.

original: las de'i byed pa po'ang med la /
analyzed: las de'i byed pa po'ang med la /
translated: There is no agent of that action,

original: las de'i rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba'ang med de /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba'ang med de /
translated: and the ripening of that karma is not experienced individually.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has understood it just as it is.

original: khyim @32a *// bdag /
analyzed: khyim @32a *// bdag /
translated: Householder,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: thus

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata has understood as it really is the knowledge of the ripening of karma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par smin pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par smin pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: And if the Tathāgata were questioned about the knowledge of the ripening of karma, he could answer those questions for an eon, or for eons, up to inexpressibly inexpressible times,

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: and his eloquence would not cease.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: how does the Tathāgata understand as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the ripening of karma?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows this thus:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: ‘The knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the ripening of roots of virtue planted with immeasurable Blessed Buddhas is accomplished. ’

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag gis yang dag pa ji lta @32b ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag gis yang dag pa ji lta @32b ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows in accordance with reality the causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the ripening of roots of virtue planted with immeasurable Blessed Buddhas is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence, up to if one abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows that in accordance with reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par smin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, who has understood the arising of the knowledge of the ripening of karma, when asked a question, answers for an eon, and so on up to: answers for eons that are inexpressible by means of similes.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence is inexhaustible.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par smin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.🔽Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is the knower of the world, the knower of the realm of beings, the supreme charioteer, the trainer of the untamed, teach the Dharma?
