analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: having given light, having dispelled darkness, having given sight, having given light, having given illumination, having given a lamp, having given a torch, having given a flame, having given a beacon, having given a path, having given a bridge, having given a raft, having given a boat, having given a ship, having given a vehicle, having given a conveyance, having given a resting place, having given a resting place for the head, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place for the body, having given a resting place for the mind, having given a resting place for the thought, having given a resting place

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata perfectly understands as they really are the cessation of the knowledge of the body constituent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog par shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog par shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha, when asked, can answer questions for an eon or more than an eon, and so on as before.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata, Worthy One, Perfectly Enlightened One, perfectly understand the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the body constituent?🔽Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata perfectly understands the cessation of the knowledge of the body constituent.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis lus kyi khams shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis lus kyi khams shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: He understands it,

original: khong du chud /🔽mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa /
analyzed: khong du chud / mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa /
translated: he realizes it,🔽he directly knows it.

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If he abides observing the cessation of the knowledge of the body constituent without relishing it,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If they abide in the view of the disadvantages,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: or if they abide in the view of the escape, the Tathāgata knows their minds as they really are.

original: tsandan @62b gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan @62b gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “If the Tathāgata were to explain his knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element of the body, he would stop speaking after a kalpa, and the assembly would be exhausted, but the topics of the Tathāgata would not come to an end.🔽“Householder, if the Tathāgata were to explain his knowledge of the element of the body, he would stop speaking after a kalpa, and the assembly would be exhausted, but the topics of the Tathāgata would not come to an end.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the element of contact as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi khams kyi spyod yul yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi khams kyi spyod yul yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, in this case the Tathāgata knows the domain of the element of the body as it really is.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mig gi reg pa dang / rna ba'i reg pa dang / sna'i reg pa dang / lce'i reg pa dang / lus kyi reg pa dang / yid kyi reg pa dang / bde ba'i tshor bar reg pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar reg pa dang /🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: mig gi reg pa dang / rna ba'i reg pa dang / sna'i reg pa dang / lce'i reg pa dang / lus kyi reg pa dang / yid kyi reg pa dang / bde ba'i tshor bar reg pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar reg pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: the eye contact, the ear contact, the nose contact, the tongue contact, the body contact, and the mind contact, the contact that is a pleasant feeling, the contact that is a painful feeling,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor bar reg pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i reg pa dang / zag pa med pa'i reg pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i reg pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i reg pa 'di ni /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor bar reg pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i reg pa dang / zag pa med pa'i reg pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i reg pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i reg pa 'di ni /
translated: the contact that is a feeling that is neither painful nor pleasant, the contact that is contaminated, the contact that is uncontaminated, the contact that is mundane, and the contact that is supramundane.

original: reg pa'i khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i khams zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the element of contact.

original: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa gang yin pa'i bar 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa gang yin pa'i bar 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge of this, from understanding to expertise,

original: reg pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called the knowledge of the element of contact.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has understood it just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa reg pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa reg pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘What is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the element of touch?’ he would answer after a kalpa, and so on.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung @63a *//
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung @63a *//
translated: “Householder, he will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.”

original: ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of the element of touch as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, in this regard, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: ‘Having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable lord buddhas, the knowledge of the arising of the element of touch is accomplished.’ The Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Also, a tathāgata fully understands the causes and conditions

original: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: by which the knowledge of the origin of the element of contact is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su lta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su lta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If one abides in the view of impermanence,🔽or if one abides in the view of opposition, the Tathāgata fully understands that as it really is.

original: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su lta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su lta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan
translated: If one were to question the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the origin of the element of contact,

original: gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: he would answer for an eon without lapsing, and in the same way🔽he would answer for an eon or however long an eon may last.

original: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa @63b 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa @63b 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the cessation of the knowledge of the element of touch in accordance with reality?”

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: ‘Having done what was meaningful for countless sentient beings, having turned away what was meaningless,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: having given light, having dispelled darkness, having liberated countless sentient beings from suffering, having brought them to bliss,

original: reg pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: reg pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can te /
translated: the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of touch is unborn from the beginning.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows that as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa reg pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa reg pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “If one were to ask about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of touch, he would answer for an eon, or half an eon, or more.

original: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag ji ltar na /
translated: He will enjoy this place between the sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.🔽Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is an expert on contact,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: know the path the cessation of the knowledge of the element of contact in accordance with reality?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis reg pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis reg pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /

analyzed: khong du chud / mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa /
translated: penetrated,🔽and actualized.

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If one dwells in the observation of the absence of enjoyment,🔽if one dwells in the observation of the disadvantages,

original: gal te nges @64a *//
analyzed: gal te nges @64a *//
translated: or if one dwells in the observation of the escape,

original: par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows that in accordance with reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas reg pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /

original: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the fine house.

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Chapter Four🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is perfectly enlightened with regard to the world and its teachings, know and see the element of tactile consciousness?🔽Householder, here the Tathāgata has understood as they really are the origin, the disappearance, the gratification, the danger, and the escape in regard to the element of tactile consciousness.

original: khyim bdag ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /

original: phyi rol gyi reg pa las kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi reg pa las kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has understood as it really is the diversity in regard to the element of tactile consciousness.

original: bar du rnam par bzung ste 'ang mi gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: bar du rnam par bzung ste 'ang mi gnas mod kyi /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has understood as it really is the diversity in regard to the element of

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa'i dbang gis skye zhing 'od ba med la 'gro ba med pa dang / stong zhing ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa'i dbang gis skye zhing 'od ba med la 'gro ba med pa dang / stong zhing ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin no //
translated: However, it arises through the power of the collection, is without brightness, without going, empty, and devoid of an intrinsic nature.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, up to the skill that is the knowledge of the element of body consciousness is called the knowledge of the element of body consciousness.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfectly realized the knowledge of the element of body consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas /
translated: In the same way, having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable buddha bhagavāns,

original: lus kyi @64b rnam par shes pas khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to /
analyzed: lus kyi @64b rnam par shes pas khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to /
translated: the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the element of body consciousness is perfectly accomplished. The Tathāgata has perfectly realized the knowledge of the element of body consciousness.

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, the Tathāgata has knowledge of this:

original: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i dang rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i dang rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows perfectly the causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the origin of the element of body-consciousness is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su lta bar gnas pa nas /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su lta bar gnas pa nas /
translated: If one abides in the contemplation of impermanence,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su lta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su lta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and so on, up to if one abides in the contemplation of the adversary, the Tathāgata knows it perfectly as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of the element of body-consciousness, he could answer for an eon, or for an eon minus one instant, and he could continue to answer for as many eons as there are atoms in the great billion-world universe.

original: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy it in this sandalwood palace.

original: khyim bdag ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: khyim bdag ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Having understood as it really is the cessation of the eye consciousness element, the Tathāgata has understood as it really is the path the cessation of the eye consciousness element.

original: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /

translated: Householder, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, who has understood, attained, and realized the cessation of the ear element, the cessation of the sound element, the cessation of the ear consciousness element, the cessation of the ear contact element, and the cessation of the feeling element that arises from the condition of ear contact, and who has attained the Dharma body, has fully awakened to all dharmas.🔽Householder, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, who has understood, attained, and realized the cessation of the nose element, the cessation of the smell element, the cessation of the nose consciousness element, the cessation of the nose contact element, and the cessation of the feeling element that arises from the condition of nose contact, and who has attained the Dharma body, has fully awakened to all dharmas.🔽Householder, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, who has understood, attained, and realized the cessation of the tongue element, the cessation of the taste element, the cessation of the tongue consciousness element, the cessation of the tongue contact element, and the cessation of the feeling element that arises from the condition of tongue contact, and who has attained the Dharma body, has fully awakened to all dharmas.

original: khong du chud /
analyzed: khong du chud /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, who has understood, attained, and realized the cessation of the body element, the cessation of the tangible element, the cessation of the body consciousness element, the cessation of the body contact element, and the cessation of the feeling element that arises from the condition of body contact, and who has attained the Dharma body, has fully awakened to all dharmas.

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “If the Tathāgata were to explain the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the eye element,

analyzed: de ni tsandan gyi khams dang khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur @66a *//

analyzed: ro; ;khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /

analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata fully knows the mind element as it really is.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag 'das ma thag pa'i yid dang po nyid du byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The first of the six collections of consciousness that has just ceased is the mental faculty.🔽

original: yid kyi khams zhes bya'o //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: yid kyi khams zhes bya'o // de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The first of the six collections of consciousness that has just ceased is called the mind element.

original: yid kyi khams shes pa zhes bya ste /🔽de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: yid kyi khams shes pa zhes bya ste / de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, full understanding, and expertise that is in the mind element is called the knowledge of the mind element.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known the knowledge of the mind element in the past, the knowledge of the mind element in the future, and the knowledge of the mind element in the present, and he has taught it to his disciples so that they may know it.🔽If someone were to ask you, ‘What is the mind element?

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that you are not afraid of the lower realms?🔽🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One know the knowledge of the arising of the mind constituent as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag @66b tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag @66b tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: ‘Having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable lord buddhas, the knowledge of the arising of the mind constituent is accomplished.’

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Furthermore, householder, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: ‘The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the mind constituent is accomplished—those causes and conditions he knows as they really are.🔽“

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has understood as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the eye element, the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the form element, and the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the eye-consciousness element.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having understood as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the eye element, the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the form element, and the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the eye-consciousness element,

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: teaches the Dharma to his disciples concerning knowledge and the seen, and his disciples practice in accordance with that teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata, Worthy One, Perfectly Awakened One, having understood as it really is the cessation of the knowledge of the eye element, the cessation of the knowledge of the form element, and the cessation of the knowledge of the eye-consciousness element,🔽teach the Dharma to his disciples concerning knowledge and the seen, and how do his disciples practice in accordance with that teaching?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this regard the Tathāgata understands as follows:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams gyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams gyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: Having benefited countless beings and turned them away from non-benefit,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal @67a *//
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal @67a *//
translated: having illuminated what was dark and obscure,

original: te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: and having freed countless beings from suffering, he established them in happiness.

original: yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa ste; de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa ste; de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: The cessation of the mind element is the cessation of consciousness, and that is originally unborn.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, clarity, understanding, realization, and expertise regarding that

original: yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called the knowledge of the cessation of the mind element.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known the knowledge of the cessation of the mind element just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If one were to ask questions about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the mind element for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges,

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: you would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis yid kyi khams shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis yid kyi khams shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the cessation of the mind element, know the path to the cessation of the mind element?”🔽“Householder, here the Tathāgata, through the knowledge of the cessation of the mind element,

original: khong du chud; mngon sum byas pa'i 'gog pa /
analyzed: khong du chud; mngon sum byas pa'i 'gog pa /
translated: knows the cessation of the mind element,

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: whether it is the cessation of the mind element that is the result of not relishing it,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal @67b te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal @67b te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or the cessation of the mind element that is the result of seeing its faults,🔽or the cessation of the mind element that is the result of deliverance.🔽The Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the cessation of the mind element,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: when asked about this, would answer for an eon or more.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the element of mental objects just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams kyi spyod yul yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi khams kyi spyod yul yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the domain of the element of mental objects just as it is.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: rnam par shes pa tshogs drug dag gis 'di ni chos kyi khams zhes bya'o //

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi khams thams cad ces rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi khams thams cad ces rab tu mkhyen to // de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Householder, moreover, the Tathāgata knows all the elements of mental objects.

original: chos kyi khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, full understanding, and expertise are called the knowledge of the element of mental objects.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba @68a *//
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba @68a *//
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known the reality of the realm of phenomena just as it is.

original: nas de ni /
analyzed: nas de ni /
translated: “If one were to ask, ‘What is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the realm of phenomena?🔽’

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: he would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag🔽pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag🔽pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: ’ The Tathāgata has fully known the reality of the knowledge of the arising of the realm of phenomena just as it is.🔽“If one were to ask, ‘What is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the realm of phenomena?

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata also knows thus:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: ‘The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the origin of the element of dharmas is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows just as they are.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If he abides in the observation of impermanence, up to if he abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows that just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan @68b gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan @68b gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: When asked about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the origin of the element of dharmas, he would answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /

analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization, full understanding, and expertise that is in regard to that is called the knowledge of the element of mental consciousness.

analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

original: 'dod pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa /
translated: he has the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the formless realm as it really is.🔽In the same way,🔽he has the knowledge of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the arising of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the cessation of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the world as it really is.🔽In the same way,🔽he has the knowledge of the origination of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the arising of the origination of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the cessation of the origination of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the origination of the world as it really is.🔽In the same way,🔽he has the knowledge of the cessation of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the arising of the cessation of the world as it really is;🔽he has the knowledge of the cessation of the cessation of the world as it really is;

original: 'dod ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: he has the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the cessation of the world as it really is.🔽In the same way,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: he has the knowledge of the

original: de ltar na gnod sems kyi khams shes pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams dang / gnod sems med ba'i khams dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams dang / log par lta ba'i khams dang / 'das pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: de ltar na gnod sems kyi khams shes pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams dang / gnod sems med ba'i khams dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams dang / log par lta ba'i khams dang / 'das pa'i khams dang /
translated: In this way, they understand the element of malice, the element of violence, the element of renunciation, the element of non-malice, the element of non-violence, the element of wrong views, the element of the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang; da ltar byung ba'i khams dang / dge ba'i khams dang / mi dge ba'i khams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang; zag pa med pa'i khams dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang; da ltar byung ba'i khams dang / dge ba'i khams dang / mi dge ba'i khams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang; zag pa med pa'i khams dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams dang /
translated: the element of the future, the element of the present, the element of virtue, the element of non-virtue, the element of the indeterminate, the element of that which is subject to contamination, the element of that which is not subject to contamination, the element of that which is material,

original: zang zing med pa'i khams dang / 'phags pa'i khams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i khams dang / 'jig rten pa'i khams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i khams dang / 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa /🔽'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i khams dang / 'phags pa'i khams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i khams dang / 'jig rten pa'i khams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i khams dang / 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa / 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa /
translated: the element of the worldly, the element of the supramundane, the element of the compounded, and the element of the uncompounded.🔽The knowledge of the cessation of the uncompounded element,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta @72a *//
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta @72a *//
translated: and the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the uncompounded element—

original: pa bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: pa bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: these he knows as they really are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the element of sensuality as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sred pa'i rnam par spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sred pa'i rnam par spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is the element of defilement through the thirty-six modes of craving.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /🔽'dod pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni / 'dod pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully understood the knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, discernment, and expertise that is the knowledge of the desire realm.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata has fully understood the knowledge of the desire realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: If one were to ask him about it, he could answer for an eon, or for eons, up to eons beyond expression.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence would not be exhausted.

original: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Householder, why is that?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa shin tu thugs su chud par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa shin tu thugs su chud par mdzad de /
translated: It is because the Tathāgata has fully understood the unsurpassed realm of phenomena.

original: thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang 'dod pa'i khams shes pa la zhu ba zhus pa'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang 'dod pa'i khams shes pa la zhu ba zhus pa'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata, who has realized this, has an inexhaustible eloquence in answering questions about the knowledge of the desire realm.

original: khyim bdag / de lta bas na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang @72b gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang @72b gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: Householder, here, whoever has unobstructed vision of wisdom

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of the desire realm as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this regard, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / khyim bdag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / khyim bdag /
translated: “Having generated roots of virtue toward immeasurable Blessed Buddhas, the knowledge of the arising of the desire realm is accomplished. Householder,

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata fully understands as follows:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the desire realm is accomplished, those causes and conditions he fully understands as they are.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence, up to if one abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata fully understands that as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: When asked about that knowledge of the arising of the desire realm by the Tathāgata, he would answer for an eon, up to

analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur @73a *//

translated: Householder, in this regard, the Tathāgata knows thus:

translated: ‘Having benefited countless sentient beings and turned them away from what is not beneficial,

analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /

analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ‘the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the desire realm.’

analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no; ;khyim bdag /
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no; ;khyim bdag /
translated: Moreover, it is a quality that has never arisen from the beginning.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata has thoroughly understood as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of malice.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask questions about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of malice, he would answer for an eon or more.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the fine mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the cessation of the path that is the knowledge of the anger constituent, know it as it really is?”

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽shes pa gang gis gnod @75a *//
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / shes pa gang gis gnod @75a *//
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as follows:🔽“The knowledge by which the anger constituent is known,

original: sems kyi khams shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: sems kyi khams shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: is fully understood,🔽is penetrated,

original: khong du chud /🔽mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa de /
analyzed: khong du chud / mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa de /
translated: and is actualized,

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if it is the case that one abides observing the subsequent [cessation] without savoring it,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if it is the case that one abides observing the disadvantages [of the anger constituent],

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or if it is the case that one abides observing the escape [from the anger constituent], the Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems kyi khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “When asked about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that is the cessation of the anger constituent, he would speak for an eon and more.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the element of violence?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is the element of affliction through the sixty-two views.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Householder, thus🔽the Tathāgata knows as it really is the element of violence.🔽“The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, when asked about the element of violence, answers after a kalpa. …

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes @75b pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes @75b pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, when asked about the element of violence, answers after a kalpa. …

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is thus gone, know suffering as it really is?

analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the realm of violence is accomplished, those causes and those conditions he knows in accordance with reality.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If he abides in the observation of impermanence,

original: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or if he abides in the observation of the adversary, the Tathāgata knows it in accordance with reality.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung @76a *//

analyzed: ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /

analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi par 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the cessation of the knowledge of the element of violence as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /

analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: Having done what is to be done for countless sentient beings, having turned away what is not to be done,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par mdzad nas bde ba la btsud pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /

translated: having made light, having dispelled darkness, having liberated countless sentient beings from suffering, having established them in happiness, he has ceased the element of violence.

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: Moreover, it is a quality that has not arisen from the beginning.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, thus

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the cessation of the knowledge of the element of violence as it really is.

translated: “Householder, when asked about the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the realm of violence, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon, and so on as before.

analyzed: @76b khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
