original: shes pa gang gis rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: “Householder, when the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of the realm of violence, he knows the cessation of the knowledge of the realm of violence.

original: khong du chud /🔽mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am; gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: khong du chud /🔽mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am; gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: “Householder, when the Tathā

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If he abides in the view of renunciation, the Tathāgata knows it just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If he asks about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the realm of violence, the Tathāgata would answer his question and continue to explain things in the same way as before,

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'gyur ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'gyur ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: up to enjoying this sandalwood terrace and this mansion.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the realm of renunciation?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas srid pa'i rnam par spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas srid pa'i rnam par spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata, with his thirty-six kinds of knowledge of the realm of existence, knows the realm of nonaffliction as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na @77a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na @77a *//
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘What is the dhātu of deliverance? ’

original: bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the Tathāgata would answer, ‘For an eon …’

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: and so on, up to ‘He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.’🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is the knower of the ultimate truth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the seer of the ultimate truth, the expounder of the ultimate truth,🔽know and see as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the dhātu of deliverance?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata has this kind of knowledge:🔽‘Having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable lord buddhas, the knowledge of the arising of the dhātu of deliverance is accomplished.’

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows this as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata also knows thus:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: ‘The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the element leading to definitive release is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows just as they are.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence,

original: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: up to if one abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows that just as it is.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs @77b pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs @77b pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, full understanding, and expertise regarding that

original: nges par 'byin pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called the knowledge of the arising of the element leading to definitive release.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has understood it just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If you were to ask about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the element that leads to emancipation,

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: he would say, ‘Householder, you will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this mansion.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who has understood as it is the cessation of the element that leads to emancipation, explain it?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata has understood it in this way: ‘Having benefited innumerable sentient beings and turned them away from what is not beneficial,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: He has dispelled the darkness and liberated countless beings from suffering, establishing them in happiness.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of escape

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: is also originally unborn.

original: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of escape.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams @78a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams @78a *//
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly known it.🔽The Tathāgata has understood the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of escape.

original: shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask him about this, he could answer for an eon, or for the remainder of an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element of escape?”

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas shes pa gang gis nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /🔽khong du chud /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas shes pa gang gis nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa yongs su shes / khong du chud /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of escape by means of which knowledge he knows the element of escape.🔽He knows it as it really is.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows it as it really is.

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If he abides in the observation of the absence of enjoyment,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if he abides in the observation of the disadvantages,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or if he abides in the observation of escape, the Tathāgata knows that knowledge as it really is.

original: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element of escape.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known the reality of that just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang @78b zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nges par 'byung ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang @78b zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “If one were to ask, ‘Who is the one who knows the path to the cessation of the knowledge of the realm of the Tathāgata’s emergence?’,

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: he will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata fully know the realm of non-hatred just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata fully knows the realm of non-affliction just as it is through the nine bases of malice.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang; gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang; gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization, full understanding, and expertise that are present in the absence of malice🔽are called the knowledge of the element of the absence of malice.

original: gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste; de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste; de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata, having understood it as it really is, teaches it to others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata a question about the knowledge of the element of the absence of malice, he would answer it for an eon or more than an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who has understood as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the element of the absence of malice, teach it to others?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di @79a *//
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di @79a *//
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has understood as it really is

original: ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: the knowledge of the arising of the element of the absence of malice.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable Buddha Bhagavāns, the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the realm of non-malice is accomplished. The Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata knows in this way:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the realm of non-malice is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows as they really are.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence,

original: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: up to if one abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /🔽gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste; de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni / gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste; de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata understands as it really is the knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, discernment, and expertise that is the knowledge of the arising of the element of non-ill will.🔽The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having understood as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the element of non-ill will,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes @79b pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes @79b pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: having understood as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the element of non-ill will,

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: will enjoy himself with the community of monks, with his disciples, in a pleasant place, in a secluded place, in an undisturbed place, in a secluded lodging, in a pleasant forest grove.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One understand as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the element of non-ill will?”

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows this:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: He has acted for the welfare of countless sentient beings and turned them away from what is not welfare.

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: He has made light appear and dispelled darkness, and he has caused countless sentient beings to be completely freed from suffering and to enter into happiness.

original: gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: This is the cessation of the knowledge of the element of non-hatred.

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: It is also a non-arisen dharma from the beginning.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Householder, thus🔽the Tathāgata thoroughly knows the cessation of the knowledge of the element of non-hatred just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of non-hatred, he would answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs @80a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @80a *//
translated: the Tathāgata
